page.title: 07LAND BIRDS IN EDAY
page.content: There are many birds on this island. For instance the whimbrel which is quite a rare bird nests here. It makes its nest up in the heather on the hill. Some areas of the island have been declared Sites of Special Scientific Interest by the Nature Conservancy Council because of the whimbrels. An oyster catcher is another bird to be found in abundance on Eday. It has on orange beak, black and white plumage and orange webbed feet. Eday is lucky enough to have a few owls here also. There are occassional barn and short-eared owls on the island.
